intro: Schlechteranthus diutinus, commonly known as the long-lived everlasting. This plant is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. It is native to South Africa and thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces showy, daisy-like flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its fibrous roots and drought-resistant properties make it well adapted to harsh, dry conditions.
